top_categories.workout_context: Rule of Three’s 300-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Every session at Rule of Three intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Racing Rule of Three isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 300 miles, Rule of Three rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Rule of Three when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Rule of Three’s kansas flint hills gravel (95%), pavement (5%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Rule of Three rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Rule of Three’s 15,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Rule of Three’s kansas flint hills—same roads as unbound, ultra distance delivers on race day.
Rule of Three’s kansas flint hills—same roads as unbound, ultra distance and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Rule of Three. Make this intensity feel like home.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Rule of Three’s 15,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.heat: September in Emporia, Kansas (same roads as Unbound Gravel) can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Rule of Three. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 300 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 300 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Rule of Three requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on kansas flint hills—same roads as unbound, ultra distance to build confidence. Expect: kansas flint hills gravel (95%), pavement (5%), same roads as unbound.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Endurance, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 300 miles of kansas flint hills—same roads as unbound, ultra distance in Emporia, Kansas (same roads as Unbound Gravel).
